item.title: IP addressing, Networks, Subnets, and CIDR
item.description: Working with IP addresses, networks, subnets, and CIDR notation can be confusing. Intended as a resource for junior engineers – as well as my own personal notes – the following offers some overview, history, and an introduction to ipcalc. Big disclaimer: I’m not a network engineer :) IP addresses An internet protocal address is a numerical label connected to a computer network that uses the internet protocol for communication.
